findings.title: Reentrancy with `ERC1155` `safeTransferFrom` and `_mint`
findings.description: In `ERC1155`, when `safeTransferFrom` or `mint` is called, the contract calls `_doSafeTransferAcceptanceCheck` to check if receiver is a contract then call `onERC1155Received` of that contract which may lead to reentrancy attack.

findings.title: Unable to `removeCollaborator`
findings.description: _collaborators[account] is required to be not true so we can not remove collaborator.

findings.title: Same KYC accounts transfer can reset liability amount to zero
findings.description: When safeTransferFrom or safeBatchTransferFrom is called from same KYC accounts, the liabilityAmount is transferred to a new one but replaced instead of increasing, allowing the old account to reset the liability amount of the new account to zero by calling safeTransferFrom again with an amount of zero.

findings.title: Cannot withdraw all loyalty staking tokens
findings.description: The Governor cannot withdraw all loyalty staking tokens due to an incorrect require statement 'balance > amount' instead of 'balance >= amount'.

findings.title: Wrong `_liquidatedBalances`
findings.description: After an account `claimLiquidations`, if it receives more tokens and `claimLiquidations` again, `_liquidatedBalances` will be set to the amount of the later claim instead of all liquidated balances.

findings.title: Upgradable contract without storage gaps
findings.description: Base upgradable contracts do not have storage gaps, which may prevent adding more storage variables in future versions without affecting child contracts' storage layout.

findings.title: Wrong requirement in dev documentation
findings.description: The dev documentation has incorrect requirements for a function.

findings.title: Unused native tokens
findings.description: The REITINO contract enables receiving native tokens but does not use them. Consider removing receive, fallback and withdrawFunds functions.

findings.title: Unused variables
findings.description: Unused `beneficiary` of `YieldVesting` and `loyaltyRequirements` variables. Consider removing them.

findings.title: Should require amount greater than 0
findings.description: The function withdrawLoyaltyStakings has a requirement of 'amount > 0' but it does not prevent users from withdrawing zero loyalty staking tokens.
